name: Murchison Falls National Park
description: A stunning national park known for the dramatic waterfalls and abundant wildlife including elephants, lions, and giraffes.
details: Murchison Falls is located in northwestern Uganda and offers amazing safari experiences with the Nile River cutting through the park creating breathtaking scenery.

name: Bwindi Impenetrable Forest
description: Home to endangered mountain gorillas, this dense forest offers trekking experiences unlike any other.
details: Bwindi is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, offering gorilla tracking tours that require a permit. It is one of the richest biodiversity hotspots in Africa.

name: Lake Bunyonyi
description: A picturesque lake surrounded by terraced hills and dotted with small islands, perfect for relaxation and water activities.
details: Lake Bunyonyi is known as the 'Place of many little birds'. It is the second deepest lake in Africa and offers boat trips, swimming, and bird watching.

name: Kampala City
description: The vibrant capital city of Uganda, full of culture, markets, nightlife, and history.
details: Kampala offers an exciting urban experience with museums, shopping, lively nightlife, and diverse cuisine.

name: Jinja â€” Source of the Nile
description: Adventure capital of Uganda, where the White Nile begins its journey.
details: Jinja is famous for white-water rafting, bungee jumping, and relaxing at lakeside resorts.

name: Sipi Falls
description: A series of three stunning waterfalls on the edge of Mount Elgon.
details: Great for hiking, abseiling, and scenic views.

name: Ziwa Rhino Sanctuary
description: Uganda's only place to see rhinos in the wild.
details: This sanctuary offers guided walks and rhino tracking experiences.

name: Queen Elizabeth National Park
description: Diverse landscapes and wildlife including tree-climbing lions and hippos.
details: One of Uganda's most popular parks with boat cruises and game drives.

name: Lake Mburo National Park
description: Known for its lakes, wildlife, and traditional Ankole culture.
details: Great for horseback safaris and bird watching.

name: Mount Elgon National Park
description: A massive extinct volcano with caves, waterfalls, and hiking trails.
details: Popular for hiking and exploring caves.

name: Kalangala (Ssese Islands)
description: A beautiful archipelago on Lake Victoria with sandy beaches and fishing villages.
details: Ideal for relaxation, swimming, and exploring islands.

name: Kidepo Valley National Park
description: Remote and pristine park with unique wildlife and landscapes.
details: Known for its big game and bird watching.

name: Igongo Cultural Centre
description: A cultural hub showcasing traditional crafts, music, and history.
details: Perfect place to learn about Ugandan culture and history.

name: Nile River Adventures
description: Various water sports and activities along the Nile River.

name: Kibale National Park
description: Famous for its chimpanzee tracking and diverse primate species.
details: Offers guided walks to see chimpanzees and other primates in their natural habitat.
